trial_identification.studytitle: Jumper's knee: does exercise decrease pain and increase participation in basketball?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Isometric and isotonic leg extensions program: does either exercise decrease morbidity of patellar tendinopathy in basketball players when performed regularly during a playing season?

interventions.interventions: The intervention exercises will be conducted four times per week at participants usual training session with equipment provided by the investigators. Players can do their exercise before or after training. The exercise program will be individualised and delivered electronically to participants with exercise prescription software. the repetitions and sets will be consistent in all participants, the weight will be individualised to each participant and to each leg of each participant to account for differences in muscle strength. Participants will record on the software the number of times each week they complete the session and the weights that they use for the exercise session. The intervention will be offered for the length of the season, this can vary between 6 and 10 months depending on the competition and the country. Isometric protocol: Participants will complete isometric holds on a leg extension machine. These consist of 5 x 45 second holds at 70% maximum voluntary contraction (MVC) with 2 minutes recovery between holds. Isotonic protocol: Participants will complete the isotonic exercise on a leg extension machine using established protocols (4 x 8 contractions at 70% MVC). The rest period between sets will be 1 minute.
interventions.comparator: The isotonic group will serve as the control group,

primaryOutcome.outcome: OSTRC outcome measure. This validated tool measures that includes 4 simple questions,quantifies the impact of overuse injuries on function and is used for all overuse injuries.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Monthly for the length of the season, this will vary depending on country and league and will be between 6 and 10 months.

primaryOutcome.outcome: VISA-P that assesses the amount of pain and dysfunction in people with anterior knee pain. The questions are designed to measure symptoms of jumper's knee, but the questionnaire is not diagnostic.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Monthly for the length of the season, this will vary depending on country and league and will be between 6 and 10 months.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Participants will complete a global rating of change in knee pain and function on a seven point scale from very much worse to very much better.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: End of the competitive season that will be between 6 and 10 months after the start of the intervention depending on the competition level and country.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The change in the amount of patellar tendon pathology will be assessed using UTC tendon imaging.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: End of the competitive season that will be between 6 and 10 months after the start of the intervention depending on the competition level and country.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Have current or previous patellar tendinopathy 2. Playing basketball at an elite or semi-elite level that will ensure they are training more than 4 times a week. 3. Over 18 years until they are no longer playing at an elite or sub-elite level, this is usually up to 35 years but occasionally players can be older
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Insufficient English language ability to understand informed consent and follow study protocol .

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation using a randomisation table created by computer software (i.e. computerised sequence generation)
trial_design.designfeatures: Whole teams will be block randomised to one intervention
trial_design.statisticalmethods: Generalised estimating equation (group and time) Previous study (van Ark et al 2015) showed improvement with both exercise interventions, to show a difference between exercise interventions with an alpha of .05 and a beta of >8 128 participants will be required.

countryoutsideaustralia.state: Wshington DC. Milwaukee, Tulane, Louisiana, New York

fundingsource.fundingname: NBA/GE Orthopaedics and Sports Medicine collaboration
fundingsource.fundingaddress: General Electric Healthcare 43614 Westridge Lane Northville, MI 48167 USA

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The impact of patellar tendinopathy is underestimated as many athletes continue to participate with pain that affects performance in games and capacity to train. This study aims to determine if we can change the natural history of pain and impaired performance with exercise;

ethicscommitee.ethicname: La Trobe university Human ethics committee
